content.headline: Essential Newborn Care: Evidence-Based Practices for Healthy Development
content.intro: Essential newborn care practices are critical interventions that can significantly reduce newborn mortality and improve infant health outcomes. Research shows that proper newborn care utilization remains a challenge globally.

sections.title: The Importance of Essential Newborn Care
sections.content: Globally, newborn deaths account for 46% of under-five deaths, with more than 80% resulting from preventable and treatable conditions:
points: Newborn deaths represent nearly half of all under-five mortality worldwide
Over 80% of newborn deaths are from preventable causes
Essential newborn care practices can reduce mortality by up to 50%
Proper care in the first 28 days is crucial for long-term development
Simple, cost-effective interventions can save millions of newborn lives

sections.title: Key Essential Newborn Care Practices
sections.content: These evidence-based practices form the foundation of healthy newborn development:
points: Immediate and exclusive breastfeeding within first hour after birth
Proper thermal care and prevention of hypothermia
Hygienic cord care and infection prevention
Early recognition of danger signs and prompt care-seeking
Skin-to-skin contact for temperature regulation and bonding

sections.title: Factors That Improve Newborn Care Utilization
sections.content: Research identified key factors that significantly increase proper newborn care practices:
points: Postnatal care visits increase proper care by 5.5 times
Counseling during pregnancy and delivery improves practices 4.4 times
Regular antenatal care follow-up increases care utilization nearly 7 times
Maternal education improves care practices by 63%
Urban residence doubles the likelihood of proper newborn care
